trial_identification.scientifictitle: Toward Parenthood: delivering an antenatal self-help intervention with telephone support for depression, anxiety and parenting difficulties - facilitating the perinatal health journey.

interventions.interventions: ntervention group receives self-help guidebooks (for participants and their partners), 8 weekly telephone support sessions from therapists until 6 weeks postpartum and networking with health professionals.
interventions.comparator: Control group receive routine primary care as usual and networking with health professionals.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Beck Depression Inventory - Second Edition. Primary and secondary outcomes will be analysed by intention-to-treat.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At entry to trial (20-32 weeks of pregnancy) and 12 weeks postpartum

primaryOutcome.outcome: Anxiety subscale of the Depression Anxiety Stress Scales. Primary and secondary outcomes will be analysed by intention-to-treat.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At entry to trial and 12 weeks postpartum

primaryOutcome.outcome: Parenting Stress Index (participants and their partners). Primary and secondary outcomes will be analysed by intention-to-treat.

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At entry to trial and 12 weeks postpartum for partners.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Participants will be women, 20-30 weeks pregnant.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Patients who are unable to understand written English; patients without a major psychiatric disorder or extreme level of distress (as measured by the General Health Questionnaire).

trial_design.concealment: Centralised administration of a coded, double-blinded pre-generated allocation schedule.
trial_design.sequence: A variable-length permuted blocks, computer generated random sequence, stratified by screening result.

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: Parent-Infant Research Institute, Austin Health, Melbourne
sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Heidelberg Repatriation Hospital Banksia St Heidelberg Heights VIC 3081

fundingsource.fundingname: beyondblue: the national depression initiative - Victorian Centre of Excellence in Depression and Related Disorders
fundingsource.fundingaddress: beyondblue PO Box 6100 Hawthorn West VIC 3122

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Antenatal depression, anxiety and the difficulties associated with adjusting to parenthood can have long-term negative effects on parents and their children. This study will test whether an 8-week self-help antenatal intervention with telephone support will reduce postnatal negative mood and parenting stress, increase health service uptake, as well as facilitate adjustment to parenthood in couples receiving the program compared to couples not receiving the program. 100 women with elevated scores (>12) on the Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale (EPDS) and/or the Risk Assessment Checklist (RAC) and their partners, and 100 women with scores below the threshold (<13) on the EPDS and the RAC and their partners will be randomised to either intervention or control groups. Participants will be assessed by self-administered questionnaires at 20-32 weeks of pregnancy and 12 weeks postpartum.

contact.name: Professor Jeannette Milgrom
contact.address: Parent-Infant Research Institute (PIRI) Department of Clinical & Health Psychology Heidelberg Repatriation Hospital Austin Health 300 Waterdale Rd Heidelberg West VIC 3081
